result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas D Schultz

defendant.name: Schultz, Thomas D
defendant.address: N7265 Country Side La, Elkhorn, WI 53121

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas D Schultz in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Thomas D Schultz.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas D Schultz in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Thomas D Schultz. Defendant still in treatment and doing well. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court + surety information.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

DEFENDANT'S MOTHER TO TAKE HIM DIRECTLY TO TREATMENT CENTER.

IF DEFENDANT LEAVES OR IS DISCHARGED FROM TREATMENT FOR ANY REASON, BOND REVERTS BACK TO CASH.

BOND TO BE CO-SIGNED BY DENISE AND GLENN SCHULTZ.

BOND TO COVER 22CF219, 21CF516, 21CM561, 21CT337, 21CT355 & 21CT442

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH S.R. OR ANY BUSINESSES OWNED BY S.R.   Not to operate a motor vehicle without an IID installed. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): KENNETH CHADWICK, KRYSTAL GEHRKE, JILLIAN LEIGHTON, MICHELLE LYONS, SEAN MASON, CHRISTOPHER MCFADDEN, JOSHUA POTTER, FREDERICK TAYLOR, BRYAN TIDWELL & SHAUNA GONZALEZ GARZA. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney James Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas D Schultz in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Thomas D Schultz. Bond amended from cash to $25,000 surety. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt:
2:01 PM (64-06) Defendant Thomas D Schultz appeared by video.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Thomas D Schultz and Attorney Bradley Lochowicz in court for Thomas Schultz.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 

Attorney Lettenberger is requesting Motion to Modify Bond be heard at next hearing. 
Attorney Lochowicz will join in on the motion. Motion for all files.

Adj. 2:04PM
Affidavit in Support of Motion to Modify Conditions of Bond
